chapter.title: What is Newton Commander
chapter.subtitle: It's a file manager!
chapter.para: It's inspired by Norton Commander. It's for Mac. Since Isaac Newton sat under an apple tree when he discovered gravity, it's highly relevant to use Newton as the name. Further more Newton is very close to the name Norton. Also Apple had a product long time ago name Newton.

Why a new file manager, isn't there already plenty of good file managers out there for Mac? Well... what may be good for you, isn't necessarily good for others. From a mac developers viewpoint it must make it easier to work with lots of source files, dotfiles, deal with permissions and reduce the need to do commandline operations. From a mac superusers viewpoint it must look and feel like a native mac application. From a web developers viewpoint it must be able to transfer files to remote sites. Further more it must be responsive, stable and useful.

seglistitem.seg: Norton Commander navigation. It just sticks in your brain, these keybindings are vital.

There are areas on your computer that requires privileged access. Example is some of the subdirs in "/var". This decision have had a huge impact how the program is organized, so its runs as separate processes as different users.
No time out when the file system isn't responsing.
Don't make me think. So you quickly can see patterns and irregularites, such as bad permissions, too big files, too small files.

chapter.para: Infographics wasn't really the plan to begin with. It started as an experiment with visualizing the file sizes as sparklines and turned out ok. So more infographics was added.

Because of the complixity added by the "Sudo" and "No beachball" goals, the plan is just to do the very basic operations: Copy, Move, Delete. That's it. Otherwise it would take forever. Of course more operations would be nice to have.
There are also some non-goals. Things that doesn't fit in at the moment.

seglistitem.seg: Lack of time to add support for it.

There exists lots of FTP clients that makes it easier to navigate a remote FTP site than navigating your own computer. Newton Commander is about navigating your own computer. When that goal is reached, then maybe add FTP support.
Lack of time to add support for it.
